doc.field: United Automobile Workers of America, District 65 Negatives
United Automobile Workers of America, District 65 Negatives

Portraits of individuals and group portraits: Group portraits include groups of individuals (mostly from within the union) such as locals, committees, union sports teams, negotiating committees, strikers, convention attendees, while individual portraits, which form the bulk of this subseries, are mostly of rank and file District 65 members, but also include District 65 officers, as well as individuals from outside of the union, including New York City and state, national, and international labor union leaders, politicians, and celebrities who supported or solicited support from the union. The latter group includes New York City mayors O'Dwyer and Wagner, Senators Robert F. Kennedy; Jacob Javits, and Wayne Morse; Eleanor Roosevelt, the NAACP's Walter White, A. Philip Randolph, and Martin Luther King, Jr. Images that were shot for the newspaper's regular "Portrait" and "Capsule Biography" features have those designations included in their captions. ("Portraits" features showed members' photographs alone; in "capsule biographies" the images were accompanied by a brief biographical sketch of the member photographed.)
United Automobile Workers of America, District 65 Negatives
